movie.title: A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To The Forum
movie.plot: Pseudolus (Zero Mostel) is a slave in the Ancient Roman household of Senex. In this house live Senex, his wife, and their son, Hero (Michael Crawford). Pseudolus is determined to win his freedom no matter what. Learning that his young master, Hero, is in love with a girl in the neighboring house, Pseudolus offers to win the girl for him in return for his freedom. Unfortunately, the house next door is a brothel run by Marcus Lycus (Phil Silvers). The girl Hero is in love with, Philia (Annette Andre), has been sold as a virgin bride to Captain Miles Gloriosis (Leon Greene). In the house on the other side of the Senex household lives Erronius (Buster Keaton) who’s away most of the time searching for his long lost children. A comedy of errors ensues as Pseudolus tries to arrange for Hero and Philia to be together while keeping everyone else in the dark. Finally Gloriosis arrives to claim his bride. Hero and Philia run away, Gloriosis and his men give chase, and everyone ends up where they started from. It appears that Pseudolis isn’t going to win his freedom until Erronius arrives home and makes a startling announcement.

link.description: A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To The Forum at Movie Collector Connect

movie.title: The Adventures Of Buckaroo Banzai Across The 8th Dimension
movie.titlesort: Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
movie.plot: Buckaroo Bonzai (Peter Weller) is a 80’s rocker, adventurer, scientist and doctor. He and his band members, including New Jersey (Jeff Goldblum), save the day on a regular basis. When they are not saving the day, they are traveling the world performing concerts. One day, Buckaroo invents a machine that allows for inter-dimensional travel. Unfortunately he brings back alien invaders from the 8th dimension- led by Lord John Whorfin (John Lithgow), that are trying to conquer the world. It is up to Buckaroo to not only defeat the aliens, but to keep galactic peace, and save his new girlfriend Penny Priddy (Ellen Barkin).
movie.extrafeatures: * Alternate Opening * Banzai Institute Archives * "Jet Car All Access" * Pinky Carruther's Unknown Facts

movie.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Book 1: Water
movie.plot: After disappearing for 100 years, Aang has returned to face his destiny as Avatar. And just in the nick of time, as the Four Nations are at war; and the Fire Nation is threatening to take over. Only the Avatar can restore balance, but first, he, along with hist friends Katara and Sokka, must begin his journey to master the four elements.

series.displayname: In the Workshop with Charles Neil
series.sortname: In the Workshop with Charles Neil

movie.title: Beyond Finishing A to Z: Spraying & Applying Waterbourne Top Coats
movie.plot:
Welcome to a New World of Top Coats
As the world of finishing moves to the world of waterbourne coatings, the biggest issue is how to apply them correctly and what is a properly sprayed or brushed coat. This DVD removes the guesswork. Charles shows exactly what to look for in a coat of finish, how you know when you've applied enough so it flows out and has the nice slick feel. What to do when it don't and how to cure the ills when it doesn't go as planned. If you are looking to enter the modern world of waterbourne finish, this is a must to have in your DVD library, based on over 40 years of finishing and spraying, check it out.....

movie.title: D.O.A.
movie.plot: Frank Bigelow, an L.A. accountant, takes a vacation to San Francisco to relax and womanize for a few days when he is slipped a slow-acting poison for which there is no antidote. The doctor's prognosis: He has forty-eight hours to live. Forty-eight hours to find his murderer! Terrifically taut landmark film, never lets up for a minute. Great script and beautiful scroe by legendary composer Dimitri Tiomkin makes this one of the finest noir films ever made. Miles head of the lightweight remake. Beautifully restored from the producer's negative. - Wade Williams

movie.title: The Flight Of The Phoenix
movie.plot:
A dramatic plane crash in the Sahara desert sets the scene for Flight of the Phoenix. The passengers, mainly workers travelling between oil fields in the desert, are left stranded on the dunes with a fast diminishing supply of water and only the wreckage of the plane providing shelter from the sun. It is up to the pilot (James Stewart) and the navigator (Richard Attenborough) to keep morale up, while one quiet member of the group, Heinrich Dorfmann (Hardy Kruger), having revealed himself as an aeronautical engineer, begins the almost impossible task of building a new plane from the wreckage of the old.
When their cargo plane crashes in the Sahara Desert, the only hope for a crew of oilmen and military personnel is to try to rebuild the craft before they all perish from heat and deprivation. Based on Elleston Trevor's popular novel of the same name, and artfully directed by Robert Aldrich. The Flight of the Phoenix is a riveting combination of finely honed character studies and an exciting story line.

link.description: The Flight of the Phoenix at Movie Collector Connect

movie.title: Hawk The Slayer
movie.plot: Hawk The Slayer is the story of two brothers, Hawk (John Terry) and Voltan (Jack Palance). Hawk recieves the Mindsword from his dying father, who has been run throw by the evil Voltan when he refuses to give the sword to him. Hawk comes across Ranulph (Morgan Sheppard) being attacked my by some assailants and soon dispatches them. Ranulph is looking for some one to aid him in getting back the head nun (Annette Crosbie), who has helped him with his severed had, and who Voltan has kidnapped. With vengeance in mind Hawk seeks out a band of fighters to aid him in his quest to get her back and revenge his dead father. Hawk brings together a band of fighters to aid him in this quest. There is Gort the giant (Bernard Bresslaw), Baldin the dwarf (Peter O'Farrell) and Crow the elf (Ray Charleson). With their abilities he heads to the church to bring justice for the nuns.

movie.title: The Last Man On Earth
movie.plot: Robert Morgan is the last man on earth, as far as he can tell. A plague killed everyone else on the planet several years ago. He was immune to it, and can only guess why. Vampires that were formerly human attack Morgan's home every night

movie.notes: A booklet featuring an essay by critic Michael Sragow and notes from Kurosawa and his cast and crew.
movie.title: Sanjuro [Criterion Collection]
movie.plot: A group of young men have returned to their home town in ancient Japan seeking to end the town’s era of severe political corruption and restore order. When they present their accusations to a city official, they are betrayed and are being hunted by the official’s henchmen. They are rescued by a scruffy, gruff samurai named Sanjuro (Toshiro Mifune) who also agrees to help them complete their quest and oust the corrupt politicians. When the rebel leader and his family, uncle to one of the young are kidnapped, the boys and Sanjuro must engage in a fight with everything they want or care about on the line.
movie.extrafeatures: Audio commentary by film historian and Kurosawa scholar Stephen Prince A 35-minute documentary on the making of Sanjuro, created as part of the Toho Masterworks series Akira Kurosawa: It Is Wonderful to Create Stills gallery of behind-the-scenes photos New and improved English subtitle translation

disc.title: Disc 01
disc.extrafeatures: Audio commentary by film historian and Kurosawa scholar Stephen Prince A 35-minute documentary on the making of Sanjuro, created as part of the Toho Masterworks series Akira Kurosawa: It Is Wonderful to Create Stills gallery of behind-the-scenes photos New and improved English subtitle translation

movie.title: Shaun Of The Dead
movie.plot: Shaun (Simon Pegg) is an English bloke who spends his time hanging out in the local pub and playing video games with his friends. He has lost his girlfriend, messed up his relationship with his mom, and is stuck in a bad job. When a 28-days-later type zombie epidemic invades his town, he leads a group of people in a trek to safety from their homes to the pub, while trying to fix his relationship problems along the way. When he gets to the pub they find it infested with zombies, and must use their ingenuity and video game honed skills to save the day.
movie.extrafeatures:
Missing Bits: Outrageous outtakes and all-NEW deleted scense not shown in theaters
Raw Meat: Never-before-seen casting tapes, Simon Pegg's video diary and special effects comparisons
TV Bits: Includes an interview with Coldplay
Plus Un-Censored Commentary: with the cast and crew, a zombie photo gallery, Zomb-O-Mater (zombie trivia)
and more hilarious special features

movie.title: Support Your Local Sheriff
movie.plot: “Support Your Local Sheriff” is a comedy that sees Jason McCullough (James Garner) passing through a dingy old gold rush town on his way to Australia. Needing money for the rest of his journey, McCullough takes up the position of local Sheriff for the small town. Here he meets a lovely western gal in the local saloon, Prudy Perkins (Joan Hackett) but this is short lived when McCullough is challenged to do his job. It isn’t long before dazzling the town with his crafty marksmanship that he arrests Joe Danby (Bruce Dern) the son of the local land baron, Pa Danby (Walter Brennan). It isn’t soon after that the Danby family sends hire guns for Sheriff McCullough who has to use every bit of wit to out maneuver the evil in this town.

link.description: Support Your Local Sheriff at Movie Collector Connect

movie.title: The Wall - Pink Floyd
movie.plot: The Wall tells the complicated and disturbing story of fictional Pink (Bob Geldof), a successful and enigmatic rock star who loses, little by little, contact with reality. The movie retraces the main events in Pink's life, his relationship with his mother, his rigid school days, all events punctuated with Pink Floyd's music naturally. Pink's success shows some parallel to the rise of fascism and just as Pink loses control over his public persona, he himself, through drug abuse, loses control of his mind, until he finds himself surrounded by a wall, the wall of his success and isolation. His inner search through his past illustrates his frustrating and violent quest to breaking the wall.
movie.extrafeatures:
Previously Unreleased Film Footage
"The Other Side of the Wall" - a 25 minute documentary about the making of the film
Running Commentary from Roger Waters & Gerald Scarfe
Retrospective - a new 45 min documentary with interviews with Roger Waters, Gerald Scarfe, Alan Parker, Peter Biziou, Alan Marshall & James Guthrie
Original Film Trailer & Productio Stills
Scene/Song Selection, and Secret Buttons
Technical Sound System Set Up Guide

movie.title: Where Eagles Dare
movie.plot: Set during World War II, an allied aircraft is shot down over Nazi controlled territory. The Nazi's capture and imprison American General George Carnaby (Robert Beatty) who is the lone survivor. The British assemble a team, mainly of British commandos to either kill or rescue the general who has complete knowledge of the Allied D-Day invasion plans, before he is made to reveal the plans to the Germans. The rescue team includes Major John Smith (Richard Burton), American Ranger Lieutenant Morris Schaffer (Clint Eastwood) and a female agent, Mary Elison (Mary Ure). However, as the mission progresses all is not as it initially seems...
movie.extrafeatures:
Making of Featurette "On Location: Where Eagles Dar"
Eastwood Film Highlights
